meanings.definition: To remove a sling or slings from.
meanings.sent1: I will unsling the bag from my shoulder.
meanings.sent2: Soldiers unsling their backpacks before resting.
meanings.sent3: It's like a magic trick - watch me unsling this bag!
meanings.sent4: She unslinged her worries, letting them fall away like a heavy burden.
meanings.sent5: With a swift motion, he unslinged the guitar, ready to play.

meanings.definition: To remove a weapon from a sling or slings.
meanings.sent1: The hunter will unsling his rifle to take the shot.
meanings.sent2: Warriors unsling their swords before battle.
meanings.sent3: He unslinged the slingshot, ready to take down the target.
meanings.sent4: She unslinged her words, aiming them carefully at her opponent.
meanings.sent5: With determination, he unslinged the bow, preparing to shoot his arrow.
